t: Zephaniah 1
The*p word of the Lord*s which came to Zephaniah the son of Cushi, the son of Gedaliah, the son of Amariah, the son of Hezekiah, in the days of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah.
The Great Day of the Lord
“I*pn will utterly consume everything From*ld the face of the land,” Says*ld the Lord;*s

“I*ld will consume man and beast; I*ld will consume the birds of the heavens, The*ld fish of the sea, And*ld the stumbling blocks along with the wicked. I*ld will cut off man from the face of the land,” Says*ld the Lord.*s

“I*ln will stretch out My hand against Judah, And*ld against all the inhabitants of Jerusalem. I*ld will cut off every trace of Baal from this place, The*ld names of the idolatrous priests with the pagan*i priests—
Those*ld who worship the host of heaven on the housetops; Those*ld who worship and swear oaths*i by the Lord,*s But*ld who also*i swear by Milcom;
Those*ld who have turned back from following*i the Lord,*s And*ld have not sought the Lord,*s nor inquired of Him.”
Be*ln silent in the presence of the Lord God;*s For*ld the day of the Lord*s is*i at hand, For*ld the Lord*s has prepared a sacrifice; He*ld has invited His guests.
“And*ln it shall be, In*ld the day of the Lord’s*s sacrifice, That*ld I will punish the princes and the king’s children, And*ld all such as are clothed with foreign apparel.
In*ld the same day I will punish All*ld those who leap over the threshold, Who*ld fill their masters’ houses with violence and deceit.
“And*ln there shall be on that day,” says the Lord,*s “The*ld sound of a mournful cry from the Fish Gate, A*ld wailing from the Second Quarter, And*ld a loud crashing from the hills.
Wail,*ld you inhabitants of Maktesh! For*ld all the merchant people are cut down; All*ld those who handle money are cut off.

“And*ln it shall come to pass at that time That*ild I will search Jerusalem with lamps, And*ld punish the men Who*ld are settled in complacency, Who*ld say in their heart, ‘The*ld Lord*s will not do good, Nor*ld will He do evil.’
Therefore*ld their goods shall become booty, And*ld their houses a desolation; They*ld shall build houses, but not inhabit them;*i They*ld shall plant vineyards, but not drink their wine.”
The*ln great day of the Lord*s is*i near; It*ild is*i near and hastens quickly. The*ld noise of the day of the Lord*s is bitter; There*ld the mighty men shall cry out.
That*ld day is*i a day of wrath, A*ld day of trouble and distress, A*ld day of devastation and desolation, A*ld day of darkness and gloominess, A*ld day of clouds and thick darkness,
A*ld day of trumpet and alarm Against*ld the fortified cities And*ld against the high towers.

“I*ln will bring distress upon men, And*ld they shall walk like blind men, Because*ld they have sinned against the Lord;*s Their*ld blood shall be poured out like dust, And*ld their flesh like refuse.”

Neither*ln their silver nor their gold Shall*ld be able to deliver them In*ld the day of the Lord’s*s wrath; But*ld the whole land shall be devoured By*ld the fire of His jealousy, For*ld He will make speedy riddance Of*ld all those who dwell in the land.
Zephaniah 2
A Call to Repentance
Gather*pn yourselves together, yes, gather together, O*ld undesirable nation,
Before*ld the decree is issued, Or*ild the day passes like chaff, Before*ld the Lord’s*s fierce anger comes upon you, Before*ld the day of the Lord’s*s anger comes upon you!
Seek*ld the Lord,*s all you meek of the earth, Who*ld have upheld His justice. Seek*ld righteousness, seek humility. It*ld may be that you will be hidden In*ld the day of the Lord’s*s anger.
Judgment on Nations
For*pn Gaza shall be forsaken, And*ld Ashkelon desolate; They*ld shall drive out Ashdod at noonday, And*ld Ekron shall be uprooted.

Woe*ld to the inhabitants of the seacoast, The*ld nation of the Cherethites! The*ld word of the Lord*s is*i against you, O*ld Canaan, land of the Philistines: “I*ld will destroy you; So*ld there shall be no inhabitant.”
The*ln seacoast shall be pastures, With*ld shelters for shepherds and folds for flocks.

The*ld coast shall be for the remnant of the house of Judah; They*ld shall feed their*i flocks there; In*ld the houses of Ashkelon they shall lie down at evening. For*ld the Lord*s their God will intervene for them, And*ld return their captives.
“I*ln have heard the reproach of Moab, And*ld the insults of the people of Ammon, With*ld which they have reproached My people, And*ld made arrogant threats against their borders.

Therefore,*ld as I live,” Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts, the God of Israel, “Surely*ld Moab shall be like Sodom, And*ld the people of Ammon like Gomorrah— Overrun*ld with weeds and saltpits, And*ld a perpetual desolation. The*ld residue of My people shall plunder them, And*ld the remnant of My people shall possess them.”
This*ln they shall have for their pride, Because*ld they have reproached and made arrogant threats Against*ld the people of the Lord*s of hosts.

The*ld Lord*s will*i be*i awesome to them, For*ld He will reduce to nothing all the gods of the earth; People*ild shall worship Him, Each*ld one from his place, Indeed*ld all the shores of the nations.
“You*ln Ethiopians also, You*ld shall be slain by My sword.”
And*ln He will stretch out His hand against the north, Destroy*ld Assyria, And*ld make Nineveh a desolation, As*ld dry as the wilderness.

The*ld herds shall lie down in her midst, Every*ld beast of the nation. Both*ld the pelican and the bittern Shall*ld lodge on the capitals of*i her pillars;*i Their*ld voice shall sing in the windows; Desolation*ld shall*i be*i at the threshold; For*ld He will lay bare the cedar work.

This*ld is the rejoicing city That*ld dwelt securely, That*ld said in her heart, “I*ld am*i it,*i and there*i is*i none besides me.” How*ld has she become a desolation, A*ld place for beasts to lie down! Everyone*ld who passes by her Shall*ld hiss and shake his fist.
Zephaniah 3
The Wickedness of Jerusalem
Woe*pn to her who is rebellious and polluted, To*ld the oppressing city!
She*ld has not obeyed His*i voice, She*ld has not received correction; She*ld has not trusted in the Lord,*s She*ld has not drawn near to her God.
Her*ln princes in her midst are*i roaring lions; Her*ld judges are*i evening wolves That*ld leave not a bone till morning.
Her*ld prophets are insolent, treacherous people; Her*ld priests have polluted the sanctuary, They*ld have done violence to the law.
The*ld Lord*s is*i righteous in her midst, He*ld will do no unrighteousness. Every*ld morning He brings His justice to light; He*ld never fails, But*ld the unjust knows no shame.
“I*ln have cut off nations, Their*ld fortresses are devastated; I*ld have made their streets desolate, With*ld none passing by. Their*ld cities are destroyed; There*ild is*i no one, no inhabitant.

I*ld said, ‘Surely you will fear Me, You*ld will receive instruction’— So*ld that her dwelling would not be cut off, Despite*ild everything for which I punished her. But*ld they rose early and corrupted all their deeds.
A Faithful Remnant

“Therefore*pn wait for Me,” says the Lord,*s “Until*ld the day I rise up for plunder; My*ld determination is*i to gather the nations To*ld My assembly of kingdoms, To*ld pour on them My indignation, All*ld My fierce anger; All*ld the earth shall be devoured With*ld the fire of My jealousy.
“For*ld then I will restore to the peoples a pure language, That*ld they all may call on the name of the Lord,*s To*ld serve Him with one accord.
From*ld beyond the rivers of Ethiopia My*ld worshipers, The*ld daughter of My dispersed ones, Shall*ld bring My offering.

In*ld that day you shall not be shamed for any of your deeds In*ld which you transgress against Me; For*ld then I will take away from your midst Those*ld who rejoice in your pride, And*ld you shall no longer be haughty In*ld My holy mountain.
I*ld will leave in your midst A*ld meek and humble people, And*ld they shall trust in the name of the Lord.*s

The*ld remnant of Israel shall do no unrighteousness And*ld speak no lies, Nor*ld shall a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth; For*ld they shall feed their*i flocks and lie down, And*ld no one shall make them*i afraid.”
Joy in God’s Faithfulness
Sing,*pn O daughter of Zion! Shout,*ld O Israel! Be*ld glad and rejoice with all your*i heart, O*ld daughter of Jerusalem!
The*ld Lord*s has taken away your judgments, He*ld has cast out your enemy. The*ld King of Israel, the Lord,*s is*i in your midst; You*ld shall see disaster no more.
In*ln that day it shall be said to Jerusalem: “Do*ld not fear; Zion,*ld let not your hands be weak.
The*ld Lord*s your God in your midst, The*ld Mighty One, will save; He*ld will rejoice over you with gladness, He*ld will quiet you*i with His love, He*ld will rejoice over you with singing.”
“I*ln will gather those who sorrow over the appointed assembly, Who*ld are among you, To*ild whom*i its reproach is*i a burden.

Behold,*ld at that time I*ld will deal with all who afflict you; I*ld will save the lame, And*ld gather those who were driven out; I*ld will appoint them for praise and fame In*ld every land where they were put to shame.

At*ld that time I will bring you back, Even*ld at the time I gather you; For*ld I will give you fame and praise Among*ld all the peoples of the earth, When*ld I return your captives before your eyes,” Says*ld the Lord.*s
